title: Mark 19 torpedo
text:
The Mark 19 torpedo was an electric <a href="torpedo">torpedo</a> designed in 1942 by <a href="Westinghouse%20Electric">Westinghouse Electric</a> as a follow-on development of the <a href="Mark%2018%20torpedo">Mark 18 torpedo</a>. The goal was to build a torpedo that incorporated all-electric controls in place of <a href="pneumatics">pneumatic control</a>s. Its <a href="gyroscope">gyroscope</a> and depth control were electrically controlled and operated, while the rudders were <a href="solenoid">solenoid</a> operated.
Further development of the Mark 19 was cancelled in favor of the <a href="Mark%2026%20torpedo">Mark 26 torpedo</a>.
